User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.5; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.5; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1

The Mac OS has a nice feature which Firefox does not use. There is a separate clipboard for "find" items which is shared between applications. You can copy text to it in any Mac application by highlighting it and pressing Command-E, then search for it in another by pressing Command-G, or you will find it already present in the second application's find dialog.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Highlight text in another Mac app
2. Hold down the Mac command key and press "e"
3. Switch to Firefox
4. Hold down the Mac command key and press "g"

Actual Results:  
Firefox finds what you last searched for in Firefox.

Expected Results:  
Firefox searches using the contents of the shared find clipboard.
